meanings.definition: A substance used to absorb moisture.
meanings.sent1: I placed a desiccant in the storage box to keep my old books dry.
meanings.sent2: The little packets of desiccant in the shoebox help prevent the shoes from getting moldy.
meanings.sent3: The desiccant in the closet was so thirsty, it drank up all the water droplets!
meanings.sent4: Her love for baking was a desiccant, absorbing any hint of moisture from her tears.
meanings.sent5: The desiccant worked like a sponge, sucking up every last bit of humidity in the room.

meanings.sent1: The desert sun acted as a natural desiccant, leaving the land parched and dry.
meanings.sent2: After a long day at the beach, the salty air felt like a desiccant on my skin.
meanings.sent3: The desiccant wind blew through the valley, turning everything into crispy chips.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a desiccant, draining all the enthusiasm from the room.
meanings.sent5: The desiccant effect of the heater made the room feel like a sauna.
